Ricky - 

>The hada is very prominant, it seems to be a Itame/Mokume mix wi=
th Masame near the ha. The Masame hada also can be >clearly seen through th=
e kissaki...O-sugikai yasurime...suguha...

All of this makes me think ko-t=
o and not at all shinshin-to work. I wonder if your sword's nakago is simpl=
y well preserved, making you think it is "newer" than it really is. Anytime=
 I see a masame running along the ha it makes me think "early" and starts m=
e looking for further clues. The sword is relatively short; is the nakago o=
riginal (ubu) or could it be O-suriage? The mention of O-sugikai yasurime m=
akes me think it is ubu, unsigned. It still makes me think ko-to with Yamat=
o characteristic; sue-Tegai perhaps? You do not mention sori; I'm curious w=
hat this is telling you. Any photos available??? 

Ron
STL
